thread.title: Bills' Harvin out for personal reasons
thread.title_full: Bills' Harvin out for personal reasons - Times Union

author: timesunion.com
title: Bills' Harvin out for personal reasons
text:
Watford, England
Percy Harvin is a question mark that no one seems to be able to answer.
The Buffalo Bills receiver, who sat out last week's game with a hip injury, did not travel to London with the rest of the team for what coach Rex Ryan has said was for personal reasons. Bills general manager Doug Whaley didn't have much more insight into the situation on Friday.
"Still just a personal reason that he's out and we'll address it as soon as we get some more answers on him," Whaley said. "There's a lot of other things that are going on, it's just not strictly injury related."
The Bills announced they signed kicker Jordan Gay and released safety Josh Bush .
More Bills: The streaming of Sunday's game from London will be available only through Yahoo.
Jets: Cornerback Buster Skrine is likely to play Sunday against the Patriots despite being limited at practice while recovering from a concussion. Skrine was hurt Sunday against Washington and is going through the NFL's concussion protocol. He is listed as probable and said Friday that he needs to pass two more tests before he's officially cleared to play. Backup running back Bilal Powell (ankle) has been ruled out.
Titans: Rookie Marcus Mariota will not play Sunday against Atlanta as he recovers from a sprained MCL in his left knee. Zach Mettenberger will start at quarterback.
Dolphins: Defensive end Olivier Vernon was fined $37,363 by the NFL for two hits on Titans quarterback Marcus Mariota.
Panthers: Defensive end Jared Allen will start Sunday night against the Eagles. Allen, the NFL's active career sack leader, missed last week's game against Seattle with a pinched nerve in his back.
Redskins: Cornerbacks DeAngelo Hall (toe) and Chris Culliver (knee), receiver DeSean Jackson (hamstring) and center Kory Lichtensteiger (thumb) will miss Sunday's game against Tampa Bay because of injuries.
Chiefs: Wide receiver Jeremy Maclin has passed the league's concussion protocol and should be available for Sunday's game against Pittsburgh.
49ers: Safety Antoine Bethea was placed on season-ending injured reserve with a shoulder injury suffered in Thursday night's 20-3 loss to Seattle.
Cowboys: Dez Bryant didn't participate in practice Friday and is officially listed as doubtful for the upcoming game against the Giants on Sunday.
Chargers: Tight end Antonio Gates has an MCL sprain and will be a game-time decision.
Lions: Linebacker DeAndre Levy (hip) and tight end Brandon Pettigrew (knee, elbow) will miss Sunday's game.
